title: First Unique Character in a String
patternTriggers: Find first unique/non-repeating character? Count frequencies with HashMap, then scan string again to find first char with count=1.

approaches.name: Brute Force - Check Each Character
approaches.intuition: For each character, count its occurrences in entire string. Return first with count 1.
approaches.approach: For each position, count occurrences of that character in the string.

complexity.timeExplanation: For each character, counting takes O(n)

approaches.name: Frequency Array (Lowercase letters only)
approaches.intuition: Count character frequencies using array of size 26, then scan string to find first char with frequency 1.
approaches.approach: Use fixed-size array to count, then find first unique.
steps: Second pass: return index of first char with count[char] == 1

approaches.name: Hash Map - Optimal (Works for any characters)
approaches.intuition: Count all character frequencies using hash map, then iterate string again to find first character with frequency 1.
approaches.approach: Two-pass: first build frequency map, then find first unique character.
steps: Create hash map for character frequencies
Second pass: check each character in order

complexity.timeExplanation: Two passes through string of length n
complexity.spaceExplanation: k is number of unique characters (at most 26 for lowercase, or n)

commonMistakes: Only doing one pass (need to count first, then find)
Not handling case where no unique character exists
Forgetting that we need FIRST unique character (order matters)
hints: Need to know frequency of each character first
Two-pass solution: count frequencies, then find first with count 1
Order matters - need to scan string left to right
For lowercase letters only, array[26] is more efficient
Hash map works for any character set including Unicode
followUp: What if string is very long and can't fit in memory? (Streaming approach with limited buffer)
What if we need the last unique character instead? (Scan from right)
Can you do it in one pass? (Not while maintaining first occurrence order)
What if characters can be Unicode? (Use hash map, not array)
How to handle case sensitivity? (Convert to lowercase first)
